thread.title: Arsene Wenger admits FA Cup defeat against Sutton on plastic pitch would be a disaster
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger admits FA Cup defeat against Sutton on plastic pitch would be a disaster

author: supal
title: Arsene Wenger admits FA Cup defeat against Sutton on plastic pitch would be a disaster
text:
Arsene Wenger admits FA Cup defeat against Sutton on plastic pitch would be a disaster 
Gunners will face Lincoln at home if they can overcome the non-league side By NEIL ASHTON Comments ARSENE WENGER has confessed defeat on Sutton’s plastic pitch would be an absolute sickener. 
Wenger warned his fading Arsenal stars not to take it easy in Monday’s fifth-round clash at the Sun Bets-sponsored non-league side’s Gander Green Lane. Getty Images 5 Arsene Wenger looked stressed during Arsenals training session on Sunday 
The Gunners are under huge pressure to reach the quarter-finals after their shameful 5-1 defeat against Bayern Munich. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
Wenger said: “When you hate defeat like I hate defeat, it’s always tough. As well, I’m determined to fight back. Every defeat is harder. I can never transmit to you my feelings about defeats. 
“A player I managed for the first time when I was 33 or 34 said that I threw up after our first defeat. Whether you are young or old, every defeat hurts.” 
Wenger, who also admitted he is not happy to be playing on a synthetic surface, needs a victory to save Arsenal’s season. PA:Press Association Arsene Wenger needs a victory against Sutton to save his and Arsenal’s season 
And he is determined to avoid an embarrassing exit like Leicester and Burnley suffered. 
The Emirates chief added: “First we have to worry about the pitch and secondly their enthusiasm. 
“And thirdly that we are not ready for a big fight and subconsciously think that they are a non-league team and it is no matter. That will not happen.” Southampton 0-5 Arsenal : Walcott bags a hat-trick and Welbeck a brace Getty Images Arsenal train on Sunday ahead of visiting Sutton in the fifth round on Monday night related articles New striker: There's trouble in the changing room at Warbury... Holy Cowl Danny Cowley's motivation for stunning FA Cup upset came from his daughter's Mars bar a week ago barcA STRUGGLES Barcelona 2 Leganes 1: Lionel Messi's late penalty sees off relegation battlers as Catalan side fail to impress again following PSG rout He Shaw is saucy Sutton United's reserve goalkeeper Wayne Shaw is famed for his 'Roly-Poly Goalie' chilli sauce Cup and away Liverpool and Man City among the NINE Premier League teams using cup action to take their own winter break Tree surgin' Sutton goalkeeper Ross Worner used to be a lumberjack... and now he's ready to cut Arsenal down to size JESUS HEALING Manchester City star Gabriel Jesus on the mend after successful metatarsal operation Peri-peri special Lincoln's FA Cup hero Sean Raggett celebrated his winner by 'eating like a king' at Nandos foxes chick it in Leicester's Ben Chilwell was too scared of Millwall fans to take throw-ins, claims Steve Morison TALKING POINT Mauricio Pochettino reveals how crisis talks spurred his Tottenham side on prior to Fulham FA Cup win EXCLUSIVE Willy Caballero fears that Radamel Falcao is rediscovering world-class form ahead of Euro clash TOM BARCLAY Malachi Linton handed chance to reignite Ipswich dream less than a year after being released I will be a manager somewhere next season says Arsenal manager Wenger 
Wimbledon players moaned about the pitch before they were beaten in a replay at Kingsmeadow, while Championship side Leeds also did not find it to their liking, either, in the last round. 
Now it is the turn of Arsenal to find a way to combat a 3G surface that was installed in 2015. 
Wenger, who has lost just once to lower-league opposition in 21 years in charge, said: “Ideally we would like to play on a normal pitch. 
“But it has been accepted and the competition is to deal with what you face. We have practised inside because that is an artificial pitch. Sutton United 1-0 Leeds : Collins’ penalty causes FA Cup shock PA:Press Association 5 Arsene Wenger has lost just one game against lower league opposition in the last 21 days 
“It is not the same because it’s a dry pitch and I’ve heard Sutton water theirs before games and is quicker. 
“The weight on the joints is different and you cannot slide to block every time, so it makes football a bit different. 
“The ball comes to you suddenly and accelerates and does not slow down like in a normal game, so we have to get used to the different speed.” 
Wenger knows he is under scrutiny again following last Wednesday’s humiliation inside the Allianz Arena. 
The Frenchman, who wants to stay at Arsenal beyond the end of the season, insists he is a winner. He added: “I am a positive person. I am a fighter. You don’t stay as long in this job otherwise.” Sutton United's Roarie Deacon tells us his Arsenal story and how he cannot wait to meet his old pals Getty Images Danny Welbeck will not be risked on the artificial pitch against Sutton 
Danny Welbeck will not be involved tonight after claiming the pitch will affect his recovery from injury. 
The striker, 26, KO’d by two serious knee injuries in 20 months, played 70 minutes for the Under-23s in their 2-1 defeat by Leicester. 
But Welbeck tweeted: “Glad to get 70 minutes to build up my match fitness. Plastic pitch at Sutton isn’t the best idea at the moment.” Ian Wright checks out the Sutton United players' shooting ability
